title: (4640) Campelo - 18 Rua do Montinhal

New and free motorhomearea.
The service area is new. There are no signs indicating where it is. It is behind the municipal swimming pools and the sports hall.  Three places.

title: (4640) Campelo - R. Abel Ribeiro
description: Very nice place for a picnic. Most pitches are sloping but there is shade. The showers and toilets were very clean. bring paper!

title: (4640-187) Baião - 127 Rua Camões
description: Piece of land right next to galp gas station (with laundry machines). it's right next to the road but on a much lower level. fine to spend a night.

title: (4640) - Unnamed Road
description: High altitude chapel of great beauty seen clear on the Haut-Douro. Heavy truck 4x4 access. Is it a fire engine route? track recorded on Wikiloc

title: (4640) - Unnamed Road
description: At the edge of the dolmens ideal for spending the night .... So calm ....

Serra da Aboboreira.
Banhos publicos chaves no café Marão à Vista

title: (4640) - Rua Cabo de Vila
description: Free park 24/7 all year

title: (4640) Mesquinhata -
description:
Paved road leading to a motorable track, more for Vans and vans, with small spaces on the side to spend a cool and quiet night, almost at the top of the hill, in the middle of the pampas...
distant view of the Douro Valley.

title: (4600) Carneiro - N101
description: Large car park located at the top of the pass. Perfect for a night. Passenger road with a nice panorama. Trash nearby.

title: (4640) Santa M.nha do Zêzere - 131 Rua 20 de Junho
title_short: (4640) Santa M.nha do Zêzere - 131 Rua 20 de Junho
description: A big square with lots of parking slots. Next to the parking area is a playground, soccer field, a park with benches and a bar. The road is closed, but you can still enter to the square.

title: (4660) Miomães - 1862 N222
description: Parking in the marina, in front of the office of tourism, near the hot spring and baths. Games for children. Great view of the Douro, quieter than near the bar. Empty parking lot off season (March).

title: (4600) Carneiro -
description: Small esplanade of dry grass along an isolated path. Very little traffic. A bit windy but great view

title: (4660) Miomães - 68 Avenida Doutor Correia Pinto
description: Parking on the banks of the Douro, opposite the thermal baths, near the marina, very easy access, we did not stay at night but it should not pose any difficulty

title: (4660) Miomães - 140 Rua de Vila Nazaré
description: Clean drinkable water

title: (4640) Ancede - 173 Rua do Cruzeiro
description: I discovered this watering hole along the rota de romanico. The water tastes good and you can probably even wash clothes and/or dishes here. There is a large parking lot opposite.

title: (4635) Várzea da Ovelha e Aliviada - Unnamed Road
title_short: (4635) Várzea da Ovelha e Aliviada - Unnamed Road
description:
Tranquility,  and magnificent landscape, this is our house at the gates of the beautiful and historic city of Amarante.
We would like it to be a great starting point for getting to know our beautiful region. Here are some suggestions for planning your trip.
We are located 10 minutes from the main node of national motorways that can take you to Porto, Guimarães, Braga, Vila Real, Lamego, Bragança, Chaves and many other cities of great historical and tourist interest. You may use direct public transport for some of them.
Amarante is our city. Small, with a rich historical center, crossed by the river Tâmega, cradle of the conventual sweets and center of a unique wine region, the Vinho Verde region.
And because we talk about wine, of course you can not miss the region of the Douro Valley, a landscape treasure that is the origin of the Port.
If you are nature lovers I have two suggestions of national parks: Gerês and Alvão. And, of course, the mountainous set that will be here in front, in the landscape of the terrace: the Marão.
But we will have an opportunity to talk about all this.
See you later!

title: (5040) - Unnamed Road
description: Spot a little dirty around, but the view has 360 degrees quickly forget this little inconvenience. windy place but it is quite bearable. accessible with any type of vehicle.

title: (4660) Resende -
description: A small road that runs along the Douro on the left bank. A few narrow places. For a van, it's ok but the U-turn remains complicated. Nearby there is a pier for boats, and there is more room. The place is beautiful.

title: (4640) Baião - Unnamed Road
description: Heavenly place with a beach by the river. Three picnic tables, but no shade. Ideal for a swimming day.

title: (4660) Resende - 813 Rua José Monteiro
description: The view is great, but there is a lot of traffic and it can be very busy on working days, as it is very used by locals

title: (4640) Porto - N101
description: This parking is interesting because it has a source of drinking water. The locals come to use it.

title: (4640) Baião - N211
description: A small dirt parking lot can be level ready along the river Douro. A spring water source of the mountain. No development. Apparently very calm.

title: (4660-206) Resende - 35 Bairro Lapa e Nápoles
description: I was looking for a place far from civilization, and it's great, I'll have dinner on the street and stay until tomorrow.

title: (4630) Freixo -
description: Louredo’s Farm                                      Organic Farm with parking lot, laundry, hot shower, electricity, point of view, animals, beautiful surroundings, organic food, etc.  We have six very friendly dogs, and they will love you!                                  PS: The entrance can be difficult for very large caravan.

title: (4690) Oliveira do Douro - N222
description: Picnic area with grill at the viewpoint

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Great place for a night of absolute calm, this has been a real pleasure for us. There are toilets but closed that day, a water tap, is she drinking? Plenty of room. A stone stairway leads to a remarkable views of the Douro Valley. The site is perfectly accessible to the motorhome by narrow roads but passes it hassle-free.

title: () Paços de Gaiolo - N108
description: Great view of the Douro. On the N-108 road.

title: (4600) - 2261 N15
description: Along the river. A picnic area associated with a small tavern with toilets and non-drinking water point. Position for the night side guinguette (validated by locals). For access: paved road. A little narrow but it goes on a path. Warning: the weekend the bar is open in the summer so ... noise to predict.

name: Camping "Quinta das Corujeiras"
title: (4640) Camping "Quinta das Corujeiras"
description: Camping "Quinta das Corujeiras" A campsite offering only one place for a small van, rather difficult to access but in the middle of the vineyards: reservation highly recommended. Great location with hammock available. Showers and toilets very clean. No services for camper. Very welcome with proposal for a ride in the middle of a river to reach a small waterfall. Bread order possible.

title: (4600) Amarante - N15
description: Motorhome wash stations and gas station.

title: (4600) Fregim - R. do Tâmega
description: It is the aquapark car park but since we have tickets for the next day I asked if we could spend the night and they told me without problem! Super spacious and super quiet.

title: (4630) Paredes de Viadores - M584
description: Very well organized picnic area! Large car park with two entrances, without stripes. So also long campers ok. It is close to the road, so I don't know if there is any noise from cars in the evening. Excellent for a daytime stopover, with tables and grill available. Field to play. Public toilets from the main entrance. Super quiet. Maybe over the weekend it will be busier.

title: (5040) Matos - Bairro Doutor Sá Carneiro
description: Miradouro of São Silvestre Cimo do Douro. At the end of a very narrow and very steep road (only for small vehicles). Extraordinary panorama and calm. If you are not the first, be the second ... after that would be too crowded :-) No services, provide water ...

title: (4660-344) S. João da Fontoura - M5
description: Parking with possibility to fill water. Not sure for 100% that it’s drinking water, but looks good, with good pressure and connection. There are narrow roads to access this point, can be difficult for wider camps. (Our is 2,4m)

title: (4600) Ansiães - 342 EM575
description: Large parking lot in a village, very nice and very quiet to spend the night!

title: (4600) Aboadela - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet (even though in  vicinity of a road) and nice place with water source and flat surface good for stopping and resting but also for spending a night. Perhaps street lights might disturb a bit. Petrol station some 300m away with the obvious service.

title: (4635) Toutosa - 28 Rua Toutosa

title: (4600) Amarante - 338 N210
description: Place to spend the day or overnight. There is only space for 2 long motorhomes (7 meters), but the place is quiet, 10 minutes walk from the city center. If you can't find another place to park or sleep, this may be an alternative.

title: () - EM552
description: Picnic area on the banks of the Douro, free parking, catering possible at the bar-restaurant in the village of Porto de Rei. Water point, swimming in the river possible or swimming pool.

title: (4600-752) Amarante - 401 N210

title: (4600) Amarante - 167 Rua das Carvalhinhas

title: (5040) Vila Jusã - 614 N108
description: Magnificent source of drinking and fresh water with parking space. Although it does not have a sign, the neighbors have told us that it is drinkable.

title: (5040) Mesão Frio - 305 Caminho Jardim
description: Small parking lot, we just landed kk instant but possible to sleep I think, pleasant.

title: (4600-014) Amarante - 374 Avenida Alexandre Herculano
description: Large free car park with spaces along the Tâmega River. Surrounded by two busy roads but quieter from midnight. Fine for one night. Trash cans in the parking lot.

title: (4600-005) Amarante - Avenida Primeiro de Maio
description:
Car park with overnight stays tolerated.
Next to Municipal Market and Market Café. Not possible on market days (Wednesday and Saturday from 04:00 - 15:00.

There are public toilets open from 08:00-20:00 and water may be available inside the market.

Lovely setting beside the river with easy access to the historic town.

Approach car park from the main road bridge. Do not let your GPS try to take you via the old bridge as the turn into the parking is nearly impossible even for our 5m van!

title: (4600-758) Amarante - 167 Rua Cândido dos Reis
description:
Park very well located, very close to the city, next to the river. Bar next door. departure of walk.
a little movement during the day but no worries.

title: (4600-752) Amarante - 541 Largo Santa Marinha
description:
Small car park directly on the dead end river.
It is sloping. You can reach the village by following the river on a landscaped and very pretty path. On foot or by bike. Nice visit in the city

title_short: (4600-752) Amarante - 188 Rua Bairro Coronel Carvalho de Lima

Mourilhe motorhome parking, camping and glamping, providing everything for a 5 star stay next to Douro River.
Prices start at 20 euros per night for a motorvan with 2 people and eletricity. 

Full price list at website

Motorhome Park | Bungalows | Restaurant | SPA | Gym | Swimming pool | Convenience store

description: Above the dam that you can cross, on a connecting road over the Duro to the north! Quiet at night, around 6 o'clock the rush hour starts! Then it gets louder! Flat place!

title: (4660) bernardo - 914 EM537

title: (4690) - Rua de Torneiros

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Parking that is taking a small road at the dam. There is a steep slope to go. A small concrete parking and another further down made of sand. We were on the second with our heavy weight. Opportunity to dive your feet in the Douro following the path at the end of the second parking. Do not be afraid of the way, it's pretty rocky. 5 minutes walk

title: (4690) Cinfães -
description:
If you are visiting Northern Portugal, we also invite you to our paradise. Our land is 1.3 hectare big where you can park during the day and night although it is accesible mostly only with motorbikes, cars and vans because there is a 265cm wide bridge before our place which has a little bend too. But if you come without a motorhome, you can sleep here also in a tent under the starry sky. 

If you travel with your pet, he/she is welcome here too, just let us know before you come, because we also have two dogs. 

As for the toilet, we have only one compost toilet, what you can use as well. In addition, we provide water but the drinking water is limited because we bring it from a fresh spring nearby. At the moment, for electricity, we have only a solar system, which is also limited, we can charge just the usual devices with, like phones, laptop, etc.
Anyway, if you have some extra request, let us know, because we have hammocks, slack line, picnic table and cooking stuffs, like camping gas etc, what we can also offer.

If you got interested, come and swim under the waterfalls, relax and clear your mind in the nature, enjoy the sunset from a panoramic view and let's explore Cinfães and the beautiful Douro valley with its amazing features. 
The surroundings also offers many activities such as boating on the Douro river, hiking or biking in the embrace of majestic mountains, looking round the marvellous wine region, walking around the cobbled streets of the fabulous small cities and villages and much more programs.

The price applies to one vehicle and one person per night.

title: (4690) Cinfães - CM1023
description: Nice picnic area in the forest of Parque do Lodario with several small picnic areas with tables and chairs. Sufficient shade. Fresh water available and rubbish bins at every place. About 100 meters downhill there are more table sets at several pools and a view of the valley. Approach on paved road but steep. Parking at the roadside.

title_short: (4660) São Martinho de Mouros - 516 Rua do Monte do Calvário

title_short: (4605) Real - 618 Rua Doutor Joaquim da Silva Cunha

title: (5100) Lamego - Unnamed Road

title: (4560) -

title: (4560) - Rua do Salgueiral
description: Small earthen car park just above the spot on the edge of the Drouo. No service but allows you to spend a quiet night away from the bar which al ere to sing all evening on this Saturday. Place flat and quite far from the road. So pretty cool

title: (5100) Lamego - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place with excellent views and surrounded by nature. I spent one night

title: (5100) Lamego - Unnamed Road
description: Place with beautiful views and very quiet. Away from the road and without noise or traffic. It is accessed by a slightly broken dirt track but without the need for a 4x4. The space is just right for a 4x4/camper, but further down there are spaces for the occasional car.

title: (5100) - N226

title: (4690) - Unnamed Road
description: Superb spot on top of a mountain with 360 degree views of the surrounding valleys. The milieu of a wind farm wind but so tranquility assured at night and in the morning! Wind turbine noise is not annoying at all. Access is by paved road. No toilet but water points, picnic table and garbage.

title: (4625) Favões - Unnamed Road
description: River beach, very peaceful and cleaned. A lot of people camping over night. Ideal for relax, take sun and swimming. The access is steep not ideal for the biggest campervans.

title: (5050-071) Godim - 6 Avenida Sacadura Cabral
description: There is another laundrette in the street next to that of intermarche, brand new with the advantage of being seated. 1 machine and 2 tumble dryer from .

title: (4620) Rio Tinto - 342 N207-2
description: Simple parking 250 m from Caide train station to take the train to Pinhao. Departure 8:50 arrival 11:37. Return departure 16h23 arrival 18h25. The train runs along the Douro on 85% of the way, beautiful! And in the opposite direction Porto is 40 minutes.

title: (5050-071) Godim - 6 Avenida Sacadura Cabral

title: (4690) Tendais - Unnamed Road

In the morning great to enjoy the place. it was calm. The bells did not ring at night, only after 7 or 8 in the morning.

title: (4690) Souselo - 3138 N222
description: Nice complete area just aside EN 222 at Souselo village, with free services including toilets and showers; each plot has electricity(6A) and fresh water. 8 places for motor homes up to 8m; supermarket and restaurant at 100 m, gas station at 400 m. Picnic tables, playground for children and fitness equipment in the field. Besides place is just aside road, it is at lower level, so traffic noise does not perturb and it is reduced by night. Many thanks to the municipality of Cinfães for this very nice place, with extended view over Douro valley.

title: (5100-081) Lamego - 53 Avenida Doutor Alfredo Sousa

title: () Santa Marta de Penaguião - 5030 EM601 1
description:
Motorhome service and parking area.
Completely new with everything you need to perform maintenance on your motorhome.

Very quiet place.

title: (4575) Rio de Moinhos - 543 Rua Souto
description: Large parking lot, empty all day. At night a bit of passage because the young people meet here, but it remains calm. The view is very nice, and if you have any concerns there is a great mechanic nearby. Quite a few strays though, so my dogs spent quite a bit of time barking. There is a park 20min walk away, and the douro is 30min away. There is a hiking trail that starts from the town. Attention, no shade, spot exposed from 09:00 to evening. And quite difficult to access because narrow street and people park there. My cc is 2m15 wide, and 6.80 long: that was right.

It is asphalted, there is a watchtower with a guard, who watches the fires, we asked him if we could sleep there, no problem. Then few tourists this year in portugal because of the covid and few religious festivals, so we don't know how this place is normally.
